de.esoco.gwt.client.app

Class GwtApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTEntryPoint
      • de.esoco.gwt.client.app.GwtApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.core.client.EntryPoint

    public abstract class GwtApplication
extends de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTEntryPoint
    A base class for GWT applications.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GwtApplication() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract GwtApplicationServiceAsync createApplicationService()
      Must be implemented by subclasses to create the asynchronous application service interface by invoking GWT.create(Class).
      protected de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTModule getApplicationModule()
      Default implementation that creates a module that renders the application process in a GwtProcessAppRootPanel.
      protected java.lang.String getCookiePrefix()
      Returns a prefix string for application cookies that are set by the framework.
      protected void init()
      Can be implemented by subclasses to perform additional initializations before application is started.
      protected void injectApplicationCss()
      Must be overridden to inject the CSS of the current application by invoking CssResource.ensureInjected() on it.
      void onModuleLoad()
      Overridden as final to invoke the init() and start() methods before and after loading the EWT module.
      protected void start()
      Can be overridden by subclasses to perform actions after the application has been completely initialized and it's main view is displayed.

      • Methods inherited from class de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTEntryPoint

        getApplicationImages, getApplicationStrings, getImageResources, getStringResources

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GwtApplication

        public GwtApplication()

    • Method Detail

      • onModuleLoad

        public final void onModuleLoad()
        Overridden as final to invoke the init() and start() methods before and after loading the EWT module.
        Specified by:
        onModuleLoad in interface com.google.gwt.core.client.EntryPoint
        Overrides:
        onModuleLoad in class de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTEntryPoint
        See Also:
        EWTEntryPoint.onModuleLoad()

      • createApplicationService

        protected abstract GwtApplicationServiceAsync createApplicationService()
        Must be implemented by subclasses to create the asynchronous application service interface by invoking GWT.create(Class). This invocation must occur in the subclass because the GWT compiler parses the class literal used in the invocation.
        Returns:
        The application service

      • getApplicationModule

        protected de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTModule getApplicationModule()
        Default implementation that creates a module that renders the application process in a GwtProcessAppRootPanel.
        Specified by:
        getApplicationModule in class de.esoco.ewt.app.EWTEntryPoint
        See Also:
        EWTEntryPoint.getApplicationModule()

      • getCookiePrefix

        protected java.lang.String getCookiePrefix()
        Returns a prefix string for application cookies that are set by the framework. It is recommended to use an uppercase string without any special characters. The default implementation returns the only the uppercase characters of the class name.
        Returns:
        The cookie prefix

      • init

        protected void init()
        Can be implemented by subclasses to perform additional initializations before application is started. The most important ones will automatically be performed by invoking the methods createApplicationService(), getCookiePrefix(), and injectApplicationCss().

      • injectApplicationCss

        protected void injectApplicationCss()
        Must be overridden to inject the CSS of the current application by invoking CssResource.ensureInjected() on it. The implementation must also invoke the superclass implementation to ensure that the full CSS chain is initialized

      • start

        protected void start()
        Can be overridden by subclasses to perform actions after the application has been completely initialized and it's main view is displayed.
